myschedule.quartz.extra
Class SchedulerTemplate

java.lang.Object
  myschedule.quartz.extra.SchedulerTemplate

public class SchedulerTemplate
extends Object

A template to simplify creation and scheduling of Quartz jobs. This class can be very handy as one stop shop for simple scheduling needs, and yet you still have full power of the original org.quartz.Scheduler API equivalent available.

This class also shields away Quartz's "checked" SchedulerException into an "unchecked" QuartzRuntimeException, so you can be more productive.

Author:
Zemian Deng

startAndShutdown

public void startAndShutdown(long waitTimeInMillis)
Start scheduler, wait for some times, then shutdown scheduler to wait for all jobs to be complete.

Parameters:
waitTimeInMillis - - number of milliseconds to wait before shutdown.

startAndWait

public void startAndWait()
Start the scheduler and put this template instance into wait state until notified or interrupted.

Note this method will block main thread execution!

startAndWait

public void startAndWait(int startDelayInSeconds)
Start the scheduler with a delay time, and put this template instance into wait state until notified or interrupted.

Note this method will block main thread execution!

Parameters:
startDelayInSeconds -

getAllJobDetails

public List<org.quartz.JobDetail> getAllJobDetails()

getNextFireTimes

public List<Date> getNextFireTimes(org.quartz.Trigger trigger,
                                   Date startTime,
                                   int maxCount)
Get a list of next fire time dates up to maxCount time. If next fire time needed before maxCount, then there should be a null object in the last element of the list.

getNextFireTimesWithCalendar

public List<Date> getNextFireTimesWithCalendar(org.quartz.Trigger trigger,
                                               Date startTime,
                                               int maxCount)
Get a list of next fire time dates up to maxCount time. If next fire time needed before maxCount, then there should be a null object in the last element of the list.

getSchedulerNameAndId

public String getSchedulerNameAndId()
This method is fail-safe (eg: good for toString and logging use.) that it should not throw any exception in getting the scheduler name. If name is not available (eg: a remote scheduler conn is broken), then simply return the underlying scheduler class name and identity hash code.
